conclusion: To determine the time at which the two waves meet, analyze the propagation of the waves from their sources and calculate the time it takes for them to reach the meeting point.
Wave 1 propagates from x = -0.2 m along the positive x-axis.
Wave 2 propagates from x = 1.2 m along the negative x-axis.
The waves will meet at the midpoint between the two sources.
The distance between the sources is 1.2 m - (-0.2 m) = 1.4 m.
The midpoint is at x = 0.5 m.
Wave 1 travels from x = -0.2 m to x = 0.5 m, covering a distance of 0.5 m - (-0.2 m) = 0.7 m.
Wave 2 travels from x = 1.2 m to x = 0.5 m, covering a distance of 1.2 m - 0.5 m = 0.7 m.
Both waves have a speed of 0.4 m/s.
Time for Wave 1 to reach the meeting point is t1 = 0.7 m / 0.4 m/s = 1.75 s.
Time for Wave 2 to reach the meeting point is t2 = 0.7 m / 0.4 m/s = 1.75 s.
Both waves take the same amount of time to reach the meeting point, so they meet at t = 1.75 s.
The two waves meet at t = 1.75 s.
